meanings.definition: A medication used to treat motion sickness and vertigo.
meanings.sent1: I took meclizine before going on the boat to prevent feeling sick.
meanings.sent2: The doctor prescribed meclizine to help with my dizziness.
meanings.sent3: After taking meclizine, I felt like I could conquer any roller coaster!
meanings.sent4: Meclizine is like a superhero cape against the evil dizziness villain.
meanings.sent5: The meclizine pill was my tiny lifesaver on the rocky sea journey.

meanings.definition: The generic name for the drug commonly sold under the brand name Dramamine.
meanings.sent1: The pharmacist recommended meclizine as a more affordable alternative to Dramamine.
meanings.sent2: I prefer using meclizine over Dramamine because it works just as well.
meanings.sent3: When I asked for Dramamine, the pharmacist handed me meclizine with a wink.
meanings.sent4: Meclizine is like the undercover agent of motion sickness relief, sneaking in quietly.
meanings.sent5: The word 'meclizine' sounded mysterious and magical, like a secret potion for nausea.
